Description.val:
Modernization/maintenance efforts supports LCS requirements to remain operational and meet mission needs. This line provides funding for mandatory safety design changes, cyber security remediation actions, habitability modifications, and obsolescence and reliability resolution to maintain Littoral Combat Ships (LCS) operational availability and achieve the full 25-year service life. Funding covers planned CNO availabilities and includes two years of planning costs and long lead time materials (LLTM).

LN001 - Habitability Modification
Habitability Mod: Modifications to increase the permanent berths to 98 on the FREEDOM and INDEPENDENCE variants for LCS 11 and LCS 13-20. The change addresses the following additional racks in berthing spaces, increased refrigeration (chill and freeze), increased dry provision stores, increased potable water capability, increased solid waste storage, and laundry capability, to support the increase in core crew size from 40 to 50 personnel. 
Non-Rack Hab Mod : FY19 and FY20 funding, realigned from OPN BLI 0944,  are to accomplish the LCS 5-8 Habitability Mod efforts not completed during the LCS 5-8 Post Delivery Availabilities (PSA).  These efforts include increased solid waste storage, refrigeration and freezer capacity, reverse osmosis plant capacity and dry provision storage capacity and will be accomplished during the first Ship Restricted Availiability (SRA) for each ship.

LN002 - LCS Ships Class Safety Design Changes
Safety modifications fund the redesigned stern ramp back-fit on five FREEDOM variant ships (LCS 11/13/15/17/19) to support 11M Rigid Hull Inflatable Boats (RHIB) operations and the installation of bridge wing for safe and effective operation of four INDEPENDENCE variant ships (LCS 14/16/18/20). Safety design changes will be incorporated in-line for LCS 21 and follow.  This funding also supports installation of the Man Overboard Indicator (MOBI) system on LCS 9-20. Note: Earlier ships changes were completed in prior years. 

LN003 - LCS Maintenance Modernization
Modernization funds back-fit and fact-of-life obsolescence changes on the Littoral Combat Ships (LCS) to include:
- Mandatory Safety changes eliminate or reduce hazards to ship personnel or components. Safety considerations include human (includes human/system interfaces), toxic/hazardous materials and substances, testing, logistical support, weapons, and munitions/explosives. 
- Cyber Security changes protect data and information processed by installed networks and information systems. This includes hardware, software, and firmware that provide integrity, confidentiality, non-repudiation, identification and authentication, and availability of shipboard systems.
- Obsolescence changes are required to prevent systems from becoming incompatible with newer technologies, or to update systems.
- Reliability changes are key to the LCS reaching its full operational capabilities for the 25 year service life. System and structural reliability modifications will increase the LCS Ao and performance, while decreasing maintenance costs.
- Maintainability changes improve ease of system maintenance by increasing the average time between required maintenance activities and reduce the Mean Time To Repair (MTTR).

Justification.val:
LN001 - Habitability Modification
Modifications to increase the permanent berths to 98 on the FREEDOM and INDEPENDENCE variants for LCS 11 and LCS 13-20 to be installed during the Post Shakedown Availability (PSA) period. FY19 Budget for CEs 1.2 and 1.4 is to fund necessary changes related to increased crew size for non-rack berthing requirements to be installed during the LCS 5-8 SRA period.

LN002 - LCS Ships Class Safety Design Changes
Safety modifications address the redesigned stern ramp back-fit on five FREEDOM variant ships (LCS 11/13/15/17/19) during PSA and installation of bridge wing on four INDEPENDENCE variant ships (LCS 14/16/18/20) during Industrial Post Delivery Availability (IPDA).

LN003 - LCS Maintenance Modernization
Littoral Combat Ships (LCS) Maintenance Modernization funding includes Ship Change Documents (SCD) for cyber, reliability, obsolescence, maintainability, and safety efforts/alterations required by the Navy for the LCS Class to maintain Authority to Operate (ATO). The scope/requirements for maintenance modernization include 96 SCD/alterations and 996 planned installations (across the FYDP) during LCS CNO availabilities driven/maintained by the Navy Data Environment (NDE), the Navy's centralized database and web-based application used to manage Navy Modernization, Maintenance, Logistics, and Workload/Performance.

The funding for Design Services Allocation begins two years prior to the start of an Availability. The official schedule for CNO Availabilities is maintained in the Navy Data Environment (NDE) and updated by Commander Naval Surface Force Atlantic and Pacific schedulers. The CNO approved schedule for LCS Availabilities included in the requirements is as follows:

FY18: LCS 1, LCS 4

FY19: LCS 2

FY20: LCS 3, LCS 4, LCS 5, LCS 6, LCS 7, LCS 8, LCS 9, LCS 10

FY21: LCS 1, LCS 11, LCS 12, LCS 13, LCS 14, LCS 16

FY22: LCS 2, LCS 3, LCS 5, LCS 6, LCS 7, LCS 10, LCS 15, LCS 17, LCS 18, LCS 20

FY23: LCS 4, LCS 8, LCS 9, LCS 19, LCS 21, LCS 22, LCS 24

FY24: LCS 1, LCS 11, LCS 12, LCS 13, LCS 14, LCS 15, LCS 16, LCS 18, LCS 23, LCS 25, LCS 26, LCS 27

FY25: LCS 2, LCS 3, LCS, 5, LCS 6, LCS 7, LCS 8, LCS 17, LCS 20, LCS 22, LCS 28

LCS Modernization Ship Change Documents (SCD) are identified in the Navy Data Environment (NDE), which is the Navy's centralized database and web-based application used to manage/schedule Navy Modernization, Maintenance, Logistics, and Workload/Performance. NDE monitors/maintains the LCS Class availabilities for their scheduled modification by Hull, by year to include the advanced planning, procurement and installation of all modernization/SCD's to the LCS class. Modernization SCDs include: Total Ship Computing Environment (TSCE) Hardware/Software Upgrade, NAVLAN Server Tech Refresh, SPS-77 Tech Refresh, ES 3601 ESM Tech Refresh, ICMS Software Upgrade, ICMS Upgrade Cyber Fixes, MK-27 Gun Fire Control, TCSE Cyber Security Layer Defense Enhancements, Galley Habitability, USV Integration, Fire Pump Modifications, Isolation Valves in Oil Cooling System, Water mist Firefighting System Mod. Long lead material procurement, advance planning and design services allocation (DSA) need to be funded up to two years in advance of installations in accordance with MACMO planning milestones.

Name.@footnote: CE 1.2/1.4 LN001 - Habitability Mod, Non-Rack:  FY19 and FY20 Habitability Mod Budget was transferred from OPN Budget BLI 0944 to FY19 OPN Budget BLI 1604. Move was to properly align the Habitability Mod procurements within the same BLI.  Habitability Mod budget in OPN BLI 0944 was realigned to OPN BLI 1604 in FY18.  (Note:  FY20 Habitability Mod, Non-Rack Budget moved into FY19 to align to current Ship Restricted Availability (SRA) dates.)

Name.val: 2) LN002 LCS Ship Class Safety Design Changes

Name.@footnote: LN0002 Bridge Wings - FY18 and FY19 Bridge Wing installations, initially planned for PSA, are to be installed during the Industrial Post Delivery Availability (IPDA) period.  This safety modification change was requested by the Fleet to be installed prior to ship sailaway.

LN003 - LCS Modernization:     The funding for Design Services Allocation begins two years prior to the start of an Availability. As of 17 July 2017 the schedule for LCS CNO Availabilities is as follows:  FY18: LCS 1, LCS 4  FY19: LCS 2  FY20: LCS 3, LCS 4, LCS 5, LCS 6, LCS 7, LCS 8, LCS 9, LCS 10  FY21: LCS 1, LCS 11, LCS 12, LCS 13, LCS 14, LCS 16  FY22: LCS 2, LCS 3, LCS 5, LCS 6, LCS 7, LCS 10, LCS 15, LCS 17, LCS 18, LCS 20  FY23: LCS 4, LCS 8, LCS 9, LCS 19, LCS 21, LCS 22, LCS 24  FY24: LCS 1, LCS 11, LCS 12, LCS 13, LCS 14, LCS 15, LCS 16, LCS 18, LCS 23, LCS 25, LCS 26, LCS 27  FY25: LCS 2, LCS 3, LCS, 5, LCS 6, LCS 7, LCS 8, LCS 17, LCS 20, LCS 22, LCS 28  LCS Modernization Ship Change Documents (SCD) are identified in the Navy Data Environment (NDE), which is the Navy's centralized database and web-based application used to manage/schedule Navy Modernization, Maintenance, Logistics, and Workload/Performance. NDE monitors/maintains the LCS Class availabilities for their scheduled modification by Hull, by year to include the advanced planning, procurement and installation of all modernization/SCD's to the LCS class. Modernization SCDs include: Total Ship Computing Environment (TSCE) Hardware/Software Upgrade, NAVLAN Server Tech Refresh, SPS-77 Tech Refresh, ES 3601 ESM Tech Refresh, ICMS Software Upgrade, ICMS Upgrade Cyber Fixes, MK-27 Gun Fire Control, TCSE Cyber Security Layer Defense Enhancements, Galley Habitability, USV Integration, Fire Pump Modifications, Isolation Valves in Oil Cooling System, Water mist Firefighting System Mod. Long lead time material procurement, advance planning and design services allocation (DSA) need to be funded up to two years in advance of installations in accordance with MACMO planning milestones.

Name.val: 5) LN003 LCS Maintenance Modernization - Safety & Habitability
